info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 11:17PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Pickens and central Oconee Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Walhalla, or near Oconee State Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walhalla, Six Mile, Salem, Lake Keowee, Jocassee Gorges, Devils Fork State Park, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Oconee State Park, Central and Mountain Rest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
